reported Friday that Eric Schmidt had been`` nudged aside.`` Ken Auletta said that after losing out to Page and co-founder Sergey Brin over the company's href="http://www.earthtimes.org/tag/China.html"> China policy a year ago,`` Eric Schmidt lost some energy and focus.`` Eric Schmidt was also criticized for allowing Google to be overtaKen Auletta by Facebook, for the company's increasingly frequent privacy scandals and its increasing internal bureaucracy. Together with the co- founders, he decided to step aside.In announcing the move Thursday, Eric Schmidt said that the company no longer needed his`` adult supervision and that Page, 38, was ready to run the world's leading internet company.`` We have been talking about how best to simplify our management structure and speed up decision making for a long time,

the collapse of such a dictatorship was`` inevitable'' in Egypt, as well as in other countries throughout the world.`` What comes next, it's hard to predict,'' Patrick Leahy said. A huge part of( Egypt's) natural product is tourism. They've got to get tourists feeling free to go back. Nobody's about to book a trip to Egypt right now.`` The United States really needs stability there, Patrick Leahy continued,`` because of our interests in Israel and Jordan and elsewhere.'' Sen. Bernie Sanders , I-Vt., had a similar response and called on the United States to support a transition to democracy.
